snippet: Tyson Chandler said Knicks players would have to play roles they were not necessarily used to in the absence of the team's two stars, a statement that may best apply to him.
abstract: Tyson Chandler said Knicks players would have to play roles they were not necessarily used to in the absence of the team's two stars, a statement that may best apply to him.
lead_paragraph: Jeremy Lin has injected the Knicks with life after their unimpressive start. He has demonstrated the skills of a traditional point guard who can drive the lane and find teammates in the right spots. But fans dreaming about what an efficient floor general could do with the likes of Carmelo Anthony and Amar'e Stoudemire will have to wait to see it become a reality. Anthony will be sidelined at least a week with a strained groin, and Stoudemire will miss three more games after the death of his brother.

headline.main: Knicks May Need to See Chandler's Offensive Side
